intro: Boehmeria strigosula, commonly known as hairy nettle, is a flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including China, India, and Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough leaves and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in spikes. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Boehmeria strigosula is often used in traditional medicine and has potential applications in fiber production.
